repnme.cdata!:
Senegal - Fourth Structural Adjustment
            Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fourth Structural Adjustment Credit
            Project extends the process of structural reforms begun in
            1985. It would support the Government's strategy to
            promote private investment and exports, to improve the
            efficiency of public sector resource mobilization and
            allocation, and to alleviate poverty. The ultimate objective
            is sustained growth, with equity, over the medium term.
            While significant progress has been made towards financial
            stabilization, public resource management improvement and
            economic liberalization, Senegal is still faced with
            important structural issues that need to be resolved.
            Resolution of such issues is a prerequisite for the needed
            supply response. The program's key areas are: (a)
            private sector incentives; (b) public sector resource
            management; and (c) minimization of the social costs of
            adjustment. The project will be supported by the ongoing
            technical assistance (TA) provided for civil service reform
            and industrial restructuring and by the TA component of the
            public enterprises reform. In addition, the Government is
            formulating, with IDA support, a series of SECALs, notably
            in banking, agriculture and transport sectors.
